title: Milestone 1: Read issues from beads and display in interactive list
description: Our first goal is to teach Emacs to run the Beats.el mode, Introduce that mode in the first place and in that mode list all issues from the Beats database. The database listing then shows in the table view the issue ID, the statios like priority, the kind of task it is, whether it's open or closed, and then also the title of course, but not the description. The description is reserved for the detail view display. So we have an overview and a detail view, and you get to the detail view by interacting with the overview, you're pressing return to essentially open the task in the viewer. Check out @docs/emacs-ui.md for how the UI works and @docs/beads-client-howto.md for the overall plan and approach

title: Milestone 2: Editing tasks from list and detail view
description:
Enable editing of beads issues from within Emacs, with a rich editing experience for long-form text fields (description, design, acceptance criteria) and convenient completion-based editing for metadata fields.

Key patterns to implement:
- Dedicated edit buffers for long text (like org-src-mode) with C-c C-c to commit, C-c C-k to discard
- completing-read for constrained fields (status, priority, type)
- Minibuffer for simple text fields (title, assignee, external-ref)
- Stretch: form-based UI like custom.el for metadata editing

All fields from `bd update` should be editable:
- title, description, status, priority, type, assignee
- design, acceptance (criteria), notes, external-ref, estimate
- labels (add/remove/set)
design:
Research findings (org-src-mode pattern):
1. Create dedicated buffer with buffer-local markers for source positions
2. Store original content for abort comparison
3. Use single code path with gate flag (org-src--allow-write-back pattern)
4. Minor mode provides C-c C-c (commit) and C-c C-k (abort) bindings
5. On commit: call beads-rpc-update with changed field
6. On abort: just kill buffer, no RPC call

For long text fields: use markdown-mode in edit buffer
For metadata: completing-read or form UI

- Pre-populates with current description (or empty)
- C-c C-c commits via beads-rpc-update with :description
- C-c C-k discards
- Buffer name: *beads-edit: ISSUE-ID description*
- Refresh detail view after successful commit

title: (Stretch) Form-based metadata editor
description:
Create a custom.el-style form buffer for editing all metadata at once:
- Display all editable fields in a widget-based form
- Dropdown/choice widgets for status, priority, type
- Text fields for title, assignee, external-ref
- Multi-line text areas for description, design, acceptance, notes
- Labels as editable list
- Submit button or C-c C-c to commit all changes
- Cancel button or C-c C-k to discard

This is a stretch goal - the individual field editors provide the core functionality.
design:
Use widget.el library (what custom.el uses):
- widget-create for form fields
- widget-value to read values
- widget-setup for buffer initialization
Consider ewoc.el for list management (labels)

title: Set up interactive testing infrastructure
description:
Create infrastructure for interactive Q&A testing of the library.

Set up a way to run Emacs from command line with minimal config that loads beads.el:
- Use --init-directory to point to a test config directory
- Create test/interactive/ or similar with init.el that loads the library
- Add mise task like `mise run interactive` to launch it
- Document the interactive testing workflow

This allows manual testing and experimentation without affecting user's Emacs config.

title: Create beads-edit.el infrastructure
description:
Create the base editing infrastructure module with:
- `beads-edit-mode` minor mode for dedicated edit buffers
- Buffer-local variables: issue-id, field-name, original-content, allow-write-back
- `beads-edit-commit` (C-c C-c) - saves changes via RPC, kills buffer
- `beads-edit-abort` (C-c C-k) - discards changes, kills buffer
- `beads-edit--create-buffer` helper to set up edit buffer with proper state
- Hook into appropriate major mode (markdown-mode for text fields)
design:
Follow org-src-mode patterns:
- Single code path for exit with gate flag
- Buffer-local state, not global
- Restore window configuration on exit
- Optional: overlay on source buffer to show "editing in progress"
